entries.title: Alabama superintendent fights to remove Confederate school names
entries.description: Three schools in Montgomery, Alabama, still carry the names of Confederate figures. Montgomery Public Schools Superintendent Melvin Brown is fighting to change that. CNN's Nadia Romero reports why renaming the schools is so difficult.

entries.title: Watch: Brendan Fraser moved to tears by standing ovation at Venice Film Festival
entries.description: Brendan Fraser's new movie "The Whale" reportedly received a six-minute standing ovation at the Venice Film Festival, bringing the actor to tears.

entries.title: One suspect found dead, the other remains at large, Canadian officials say
entries.description:
• Live Updates: Here's what we know so far about how the attacks unfolded
• Number of injured increases to 18

entries.title: One of the biggest strikes in US history is brewing at UPS
entries.description: Over the past year, the nascent labor movements at mighty corporations like Starbucks and Amazon have grabbed national attention. But less well-known is a looming high-stakes clash between one of America's oldest unions and the world's biggest package courier.

entries.title: Cognitive training works best when you have positive expectations, study shows
entries.description: Can thinking that you can get up the hill actually get you up the hill?

entries.title: Ukraine says it struck base used by Russia in Zaporizhzhia
'The inbox from hell': British journalist lays out challenges for new UK PM
entries.description: Veteran British journalist Andrew Neil says that if the UK's new prime minister Liz Truss doesn't deal with the energy crisis, "she won't be PM for long."

entries.title: Tiffany Haddish speaks out on child sex abuse suit
entries.description: Tiffany Haddish says she "deeply" regrets performing in a skit years ago that led to her and fellow comedic actor Aries Spears being accused of child sex abuse.

entries.title: Stunning new 8K footage shows Titanic as it's never been seen before
entries.description: New footage has been released showing the wreck of the RMS Titanic as it's never been seen before: in full 8K quality, the highest screen resolution currently available.

entries.title: Russian court sentences former journalist to 22 years in jail
Zaporizhzhia's last operating reactor disconnected from grid
READ: Judge's ruling on special master for Mar-a-Lago documents
Minks were thought to be impossible to tame. Enter: The 'Mink Man."
entries.description: Joseph Carter aka the "Mink Man," explains to "Nightcap's" Jon Sarlin how he managed to become YouTube's top mink trainer.

entries.title: Judge grants Trump's request for a 'special master' to review materials seized from Mar-a-Lago
entries.description: A federal judge has granted former President Donald Trump's request to appoint a "special master" to review materials that the FBI seized from Mar-a-Lago last month.

entries.title: Venice Film Festival: The best fashion on show
entries.description: As the 79th installment of the Venice Film Festival continues this week, there's been no shortage of celebrity fashion moments thanks to premieres like Noah Baumbach's "White Noise," starring Greta Gerwig and Adam Driver, the buzzy "Don't Worry Darling" directed by Olivia Wilde featuring Harry Styles and Florence Pugh, as well as  "Blonde" -- Netflix's Marilyn Monroe biopic with Ana de Armas.

entries.title: Naked 'Nevermind' baby loses lawsuit against Nirvana after judge dismisses child pornography complaint
entries.description: A federal court in California has dismissed a lawsuit alleging that the cover artwork of rock band Nirvana's 1991 album "Nevermind" constituted child pornography.

entries.title: Pat Stay, acclaimed Canadian battle rapper, fatally stabbed
entries.description: Rapper Pat Stay has died following a stabbing incident in Nova Scotia, Canada, according to regional police. He was 36.

entries.title: Analysis: Liz Truss will inherit a party now well versed in regicide
entries.description: Liz Truss will take over from Boris Johnson as prime minister of the UK with an in-tray that may leave her wondering why she wanted the job in the first place.

entries.title: Luke Combs refunded a concert over the weekend because his voice wasn't up to par
entries.description: Luke Combs may be one of the most generous stars in country music.

entries.title: 'Suggestive' photographs are the reason Hillary Clinton wears pant suits
entries.description: In an interview with CBS, former first lady and presidential candidate Hillary Clinton revealed the reason why she wears the pantsuits she has become iconic for.

entries.title: 'Doomsday glacier,' which could raise sea level by several feet, is holding on 'by its fingernails,' scientists say
entries.description: Antarctica's so-called "doomsday glacier" -- nicknamed because of its high risk of collapse and threat to global sea level -- has the potential to rapidly retreat in the coming years, scientists say, amplifying concerns over the extreme sea level rise that would accompany its potential demise.

entries.title: Israel U-turns on relationship rules for West Bank
entries.description: The Israeli government has dropped some of the most controversial rules in a draft ordinance controlling how foreigners can enter and stay in the occupied West Bank.

entries.title: Reporter explains why voters rejected Chile's proposed constitution
entries.description: CNN's Rafael Romo explains why voters in Chile overwhelmingly rejected a proposed leftist national constitution and what's next in the process.

entries.title: Ukraine says it has inflicted losses on Russian forces in Kherson, 'upbeat' about counteroffensive
entries.description: • CNN report: This disturbing trend has become 'staggeringly common' in Putin's wartime Russia

entries.title: 15 and counting: The Queen prepares to appoint her newest PM
Canadian prime minister calls Saskatchewan stabbings 'horrific and heartbreaking'
Russian court revokes print license for one of the country's last independent newspapers
Manhunt underway after at least 10 killed in Canada stabbings. Here's what we know
entries.description: A manhunt is underway in Canada for two "armed and dangerous" men who are suspects in a mass stabbing Sunday that left at least 10 dead and 15 injured at multiple scenes in an Indigenous community and the surrounding area in Saskatchewan, authorities say.

entries.title: Top seed Daniil Medvedev beaten by Nick Kyrgios at US Open
entries.description: Defending champion Daniil Medvedev was knocked out of the US Open after losing 6-7 6-3 3-6 2-6 against Nick Kyrgios in the fourth round.

entries.title: There's talk of razing Robb Elementary School and rebuilding it. Here's what happened after other school massacres
entries.description: Just months after the devastating mass shooting in Uvalde, Texas, students are set to return to class on Tuesday. But survivors will never return to the building where 19 of their classmates and two teachers were massacred in May.

entries.title: Two Russian embassy staff killed in Kabul suicide blast
entries.description: Two Russian embassy employees in Kabul were killed in a suicide blast near the embassy on Monday, the Russian foreign ministry said.

entries.title: See how one doctor uses video games to treat long-Covid
entries.description: CNN chief medical correspondent Dr. Sanjay Gupta reports on an experimental treatment for "brain fog" that could help what some long-Covid patients experience.

entries.title: Europe's Russian energy crisis is escalating and so are the costs
entries.description: Europe's energy crisis is deepening as Russia further limits exports of natural gas, forcing governments to spend billions to protect businesses and consumers from soaring bills as the region slides towards recession.

entries.title: Manhunt underway in Canada after deadly mass stabbing
entries.description: • Canadian authorities are hunting for two suspects

entries.title: See the moment Tory Party announced Truss won leadership
entries.description: Boris Johnson's successor as British prime minister will be Liz Truss, a low-tax evangelist who models herself on Margaret Thatcher. Truss won the vote to become leader of the Conservative Party after a leadership contest prompted by Johnson's resignation.

entries.title: These US states will have abortion on ballot
entries.description: Voters in a small number of states will decide in November how those states should handle the abortion issue. Abortion rights have taken on an increased significance and become a top focus in the midterm elections after the US Supreme Court's ruling this summer that there was no longer a federal constitutional right to the procedure.

entries.title: OPEC agrees to cut production after oil price slump
entries.description: OPEC said Monday it would reduce oil production next month, the cartel's first output cut since the depths of the pandemic, as it braces for a global economic slowdown to hit demand.

entries.title: Liz Truss to succeed Boris Johnson as British prime minister, inheriting a country in crisis
British Foreign Secretary beats opponent Rishi Sunak to succeed Boris Johnson as UK prime minister after winning Conservative Party leadership contest
entries.description: Liz Truss will be the next prime minister of the United Kingdom after winning most votes in the Conservative Party leadership contest, succeeding Boris Johnson who resigned in July after a series of scandals.

entries.title: Opinion: Britain in 2022 is feeling a lot like 1979
entries.description: If the interminable campaign to elect a new British prime minister this summer has at times felt haunted by one of the most influential figures ever to hold the post, Margaret Thatcher, the specter is less Macbeth's Banquo, more Casper the Friendly Ghost.

entries.title: Analysis: Britain's new prime minister is a political shape-shifter. Now she's set for her toughest transformation yet.
entries.description: Liz Truss, the next prime minister of the United Kingdom, is a political chameleon who has gone from a radical who called for the abolition of the monarchy to a flag-bearer of the Euroskeptic right wing of the Conservative Party.

entries.title: Olivia Wilde brings 'Don't Worry Darling' to Venice, dismisses 'endless tabloid gossip' about the film
entries.description: Olivia Wilde's upcoming film "Don't Worry Darling" took center stage at the Venice Film Festival on Monday.

entries.title: More than 80 million people are under flood watches today, from Alabama to Maine
entries.description: Moisture streaming in from the Gulf of Mexico, combined with a stubborn, nearly stationary storm system, will cause slow-moving thunderstorm activity and the possibility of flash flooding across 20 US states Monday.

entries.title: Kenya's Supreme Court confirms William Ruto's victory in presidential vote
entries.description: Kenya's Supreme Court on Monday upheld results declaring William Ruto winner of last month's presidential elections.

entries.title: Kelly Clarkson reflects on 'American Idol' win 20 (!!) years ago
entries.description: I hope you're sitting down: It's been 20 years since Kelly Clarkson won "American Idol."

entries.title: Black Lives Matter executive accused of 'syphoning' $10M from BLM donors, suit says
entries.description: An executive at Black Lives Matter Global Network Foundation (GNF), is accused of "syphoning" more than $10 million from donors, the grassroots arm of the BLM organization said a court filing this week.

entries.title: Europe's Russian energy crisis is escalating and so are the costs
Wastewater surveillance becomes more targeted in search for poliovirus, monkeypox and coronavirus
entries.description: Early in the coronavirus pandemic, health officials closely monitored sewage samples for signs of the virus to track where it could be circulating. Now, that technique is being used to detect other infectious diseases: polio and monkeypox.

entries.title: WNBA playoffs: Las Vegas Aces beat Seattle Storm in OT in Game 3 after remarkable end to regulation time
entries.description: The Las Vegas Aces beat the Seattle Storm in a dramatic 110-98 overtime victory to win Game 3 and take a 2-1 lead in their WNBA playoff series.

entries.title: Albert Pujols blasts 695th career HR in Cardinals game to move one shy of fourth on all-time list
entries.description: There's an exclusive club reserved for those who have scored 700 career home runs which just three players belong to -- Barry Bonds, Hank Aaron and Babe Ruth. And now, another man is closing in on that iconic group.

entries.title: Hear Pope Francis' comments on abuse in the Catholic Church
entries.description: In a wide-ranging, exclusive interview, Pope Francis spoke to CNN's partner channel CNN Portugal. The interview touched on the issue of abuse in the Catholic Church and the war in Ukraine.

entries.title: A synthetic embryo, made without sperm or egg, could lead to infertility treatments
entries.description: Scientists have created mouse embryos in a dish, and it could one day help families hoping to get pregnant, according to a new study.

entries.title: Rescuers search for survivors after eight die while trying to climb Russian volcano
entries.description: Rescuers are trying to reach survivors of a climbing expedition on Eurasia's highest volcano that has already claimed eight lives as of Monday, local authorities say.

entries.title: Alisyn Camerota: What I learned about the 'baby business' more than 15 years after undergoing IVF
entries.description: Approximately one in every 50 kids born in the United States today is conceived in a fertility clinic or lab, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).

entries.title: Flood-hit Pakistan breaches lake in bid to save densely populated cities
Why this remote corner of Asia has been dubbed the 'last paradise on Earth'
entries.description: More than 30 years ago, Dutchman and history enthusiast Max Ammer received a lead from his then-landlord, a war veteran, about submerged WWII aircraft in the waters of Indonesia.

entries.title: Foo Fighters pay tribute to drummer Taylor Hawkins at emotional London concert
entries.description: A star-studded line-up, including Paul McCartney and Liam Gallagher, joined the Foo Fighters for an emotional tribute to the band's drummer Taylor Hawkins at a concert in London on Saturday night.

entries.title: Hear what professor who studies civil wars thinks is happening to US democracy
entries.description: University of California - San Diego professor Barbara Walter, author of "How Civil Wars Start", says that there is a faction of the Republican party who wants to unravel the US democracy due to former President Donald Trump engaging in "fear-mongering."
